# Nothing Phone (2a) Plus ufficiale: potenza e stile si fondono nel nuovo medio gamma

[HW Upgrade](https://www.hwupgrade.it/news/telefonia/nothing-phone-2a-plus-ufficiale-potenza-e-stile-si-fondono-nel-nuovo-medio-gamma_129393.html)

Nothing alza l'asticella nel segmento di mercato dei dispositivi di fascia media con il lancio del nuovo Phone (2a) Plus. Questo smartphone, evoluzione del popolare Phone (2a), punta a offrire un'esperienza d'uso elevata concentrandosi su tre aspetti chiave: prestazioni, fotocamera e design. L'azienda londinese, fondata nel 2020 da Carl Pei, continua così la sua missione di rendere la tecnologia nuovamente entusiasmante, portando innovazione e freschezza in un mercato spesso caratterizzato da proposte omogenee.
Cuore pulsante: il MediaTek Dimensity 7350 Pro 5G
La vera novità sotto il cofano è rappresentata dal processore MediaTek Dimensity 7350 Pro 5G, sviluppato in esclusiva mondiale per Nothing. Realizzato con processo produttivo TSMC a 4 nm di seconda generazione, questo SoC vanta 8 core che possono spingersi fino a 3,0 GHz, garantendo prestazioni quasi del 10% superiori rispetto al predecessore. Il comparto grafico è affidato alla GPU ARM Mali-G610 MC4 con clock a 1,3 GHz, che promette un boost del 30% nelle prestazioni gaming. Questa combinazione rende il Phone (2a) Plus particolarmente appetibile per gli appassionati di giochi mobile, che potranno godere di frame rate più elevati e grafica più fluida.
A supporto delle prestazioni troviamo la tecnologia Smart Clean per l'ottimizzazione dei file di sistema, trasferimenti dati ultraveloci grazie al filesystem NTFS e un RAM Booster in grado di espandere la memoria fino a 20 GB effettivi. Queste ottimizzazioni software, unite all'hardware potenziato, promettono un'esperienza d'uso fluida e reattiva in ogni situazione, dal multitasking intenso all'elaborazione di contenuti pesanti.
Fotocamere: triplo sensore da 50 MP per scatti al top
Il comparto fotografico fa un deciso passo in avanti, mantenendo la configurazione a triplo sensore da 50 MP ma migliorando sensibilmente le prestazioni. La fotocamera principale vanta un'apertura f/1.88 per catturare più luce, ideale per scatti in condizioni di scarsa illuminazione. Questa è affiancata da un sensore ultrawide con campo visivo di 114°, perfetto per paesaggi e foto di gruppo.
La vera novità è però rappresentata dalla selfie camera, che passa dai 32 MP del modello base a ben 50 MP, supportando ora la registrazione video 4K a 30 fps. Questo miglioramento si traduce in selfie più dettagliati e videochiamate di qualità superiore, un aspetto sempre più importante nell'era del lavoro e della socializzazione a distanza.
Tutte le fotocamere possono scattare direttamente a 50 MP e registrare video in 4K, offrendo una versatilità notevole per un dispositivo di fascia media. La principale beneficia inoltre di stabilizzazione ottica ed elettronica dell'immagine, oltre alla modalità Azione per riprese fluide in movimento, caratteristiche solitamente riservate a smartphone di fascia più alta.
Sul fronte software troviamo il TrueLens Engine con AI Vivid Mode per foto realistiche e ricche di dettagli, mentre la funzione Ultra XDR sviluppata in collaborazione con Google ottimizza l'illuminazione in condizioni difficili, regolando la luminosità dei pixel fino a 5 volte. Non mancano modalità come Motion Capture per scatti d'azione privi di sfocature, Night Mode per migliorare la fotografia in condizioni di scarsa illuminazione e AI Portrait Optimiser per scatti di gruppo di alto livello.
Design: metallo e minimalismo
Esteticamente, il Phone (2a) Plus si veste di due nuove colorazioni metalliche: grigio e nero. La finitura richiama quella di un macchinario di precisione, conferendo un look più premium pur mantenendo il linguaggio di design caratteristico di Nothing. Questa scelta estetica non solo migliora l'aspetto del dispositivo, ma ne aumenta anche la resistenza e la percezione di qualità al tatto.
Il layout posteriore conserva l'aspetto "antropomorfo" con le fotocamere che ricordano due occhi, mentre al centro troviamo l'iconica Glyph Interface per interagire con lo smartphone tramite pattern luminosi. Questa caratteristica distintiva di Nothing continua a differenziare i suoi dispositivi dalla concorrenza, offrendo un modo unico e intuitivo di ricevere notifiche e informazioni senza dover necessariamente guardare lo schermo.
Display AMOLED e batteria generosa
Il frontale è dominato da un ampio display AMOLED da 6,7 pollici con risoluzione Full HD+ e refresh rate adattivo fino a 120 Hz. La tecnologia Active Matrix garantisce un controllo preciso su ogni singolo pixel, contribuendo a una migliore qualità dell'immagine senza compromettere l'autonomia. La luminosità di picco tocca i 1300 nit per un'ottima visibilità all'aperto, mentre le cornici simmetriche da soli 2,1 mm su tutti i lati consentono di raggiungere un rapporto schermo/corpo del 91,65%, offrendo un'esperienza visiva immersiva.
L'autonomia è affidata a una capiente batteria da 5.000 mAh in grado di garantire fino a due giorni di utilizzo. La ricarica rapida da 50W permette di ottenere un'intera giornata di autonomia in soli 20 minuti, con prestazioni migliorate del 10% rispetto al modello base. Nothing afferma che la batteria mantiene oltre il 90% della sua capacità anche dopo 1.000 cicli di ricarica, un dato importante per la longevità del dispositivo.
Software e AI
Il sistema operativo è basato su Android 14 con interfaccia Nothing OS 2.6, che introduce nuovi widget funzionali per la home e la lock screen. L'azienda ha ampliato la sua libreria di widget per offrire interazioni più consapevoli, con visualizzazioni e animazioni scorrevoli per un maggior numero di livelli di informazione. Particolarmente interessante è l'integrazione dell'intelligenza artificiale con il widget News Reporter. Questa funzionalità innovativa aggrega le notizie quotidiane in un formato semplice e intuitivo, leggendole ad alta voce con la voce di Tim Holbrow, CFO di Nothing. Gli utenti possono scegliere tra otto categorie di notizie, tra cui affari, intrattenimento, salute, scienza e tecnologia. Ogni riassunto dura 1 minuto, per un totale di 8 storie al giorno, aggiornate automaticamente ogni mattina.
Nothing promette 3 anni di aggiornamenti software e 4 anni di patch di sicurezza, superando molti concorrenti in questa fascia di prezzo e garantendo una maggiore longevità al dispositivo.
Sostenibilità al centro
Nothing conferma il suo impegno per l'ambiente, con un'impronta di carbonio di 53,34 kg CO2e per unità. Il dispositivo fa ampio uso di materiali riciclati, tra cui alluminio al 100% per il telaio, stagno e rame riciclati nei circuiti stampati e oltre il 50% della plastica proveniente da fonti sostenibili. L'azienda ha anche trovato un modo creativo per riutilizzare gli scarti di plastica della linea di produzione degli auricolari Ear (2) nel Phone (2a) Plus, dimostrando un approccio olistico alla sostenibilità.
Questo impegno verso pratiche più ecologiche non solo riduce l'impatto ambientale del dispositivo, ma risponde anche alla crescente domanda dei consumatori per prodotti più sostenibili nel settore tecnologico.
Scheda Tecnica Nothing Phone (2a) Plus
  display: AMOLED da 6.7", Corning Gorilla Glass 5, 1.084 x 2.412 pixel (394 ppi), frequenza di aggiornamento adattiva 30-120 Hz, frequenza di campionamento touch 240 Hz, frequenza PWM 2.160 Hz, luminosità massima 1.300 nit
  Processore: MediaTek Dimensity 7350 Pro

  audio: stereo

Prezzi e disponibilità
Il Nothing Phone (2a) Plus si propone come un'interessante evoluzione nel segmento medio, offrendo prestazioni migliorate, un comparto fotografico di alto livello e un design distintivo. La disponibilità e i prezzi in euro e in Italia saranno annunciati a settembre, ma ci aspettiamo un posizionamento competitivo per sfidare i principali player del mercato. Al momento sappiamo solo il  prezzo in sterline della versione da 12+256GB che è pari a 399£ GBP.  Non solo perché  a Londra, il Nothing Store Soho sarà il primo luogo al mondo in cui sarà possibile acquistare il nuovo dispositivo, a partire dalle 12:00 di sabato 3 agosto. 
Con questo lancio, Nothing dimostra di voler alzare l'asticella anche nella fascia media, portando alcune caratteristiche premium in un segmento più accessibile. La strategia dell'azienda sembra chiara: offrire dispositivi che si distinguono non solo per le specifiche tecniche, ma anche per design e funzionalità uniche. Il successo del Phone (2a) Plus potrebbe aprire la strada a ulteriori innovazioni nel portfolio di Nothing. L'azienda ha già annunciato il lancio del Phone (3), suggerendo un piano di sviluppo a lungo termine per la sua linea di smartphone. Inoltre, l'espansione nel settore audio con auricolari wireless e l'introduzione del sub-brand CMF by Nothing indicano la volontà di creare un ecosistema completo di prodotti tecnologici.

# Deal zum "Bestseller-Nachfolger": Samsung UHD-TV zum Tiefstpreis unter 500 Euro

[PC Games Hardware](https://www.pcgameshardware.de/Fernseher-Hardware-134500/News/Samsung-DU7179-zum-Tiefstpreis-1452684/)

Startseite
Fernseher
News
 
31.07.2024 um 10:29 Uhr
Quelle: Erstellt mit Dall-E; Amazon; Montage: PCGH
Kein OLED-TV, sondern ein smarter UHD-Fernseher stand wochenlang auf Platz 1 bei Amazon. Nun gibt es den Nachfolger günstig wie noch nie für unter 500 Euro. 
Wer nach der Fußball-EM in Deutschland auch Olympia aus Paris auf einem aktuellen TV erleben will, muss dafür nicht mal 500 Euro ausgeben. Das beweist ein aktuelles, befristetes Angebot zum Samsung-TV DU7179. Dabei handelt es sich um den Nachfolger des Bestseller-TVs Samsung CU7179. Was können Käufer des Schnäppchen-TVs erwarten?Was hat der Samsung DU7179 zu bieten?Mit der Modellreihe DU7179 bringt Samsung einen neuen Einsteiger-TV auf den Markt. Um die Bildverbesserung kümmert sich ein ARM-Chipsatz namens Crystal Processor 4K. Hierbei kümmert sich der Prozessor u.a. um das 4K Upscaling, um Full-HD-Inhalte hochzurechnen. Mit der Funktion Contrast Enhancer soll das Kontrastverhältnis automatisch ans Gesamtbild angepasst werden. Laut Hersteller unterstützt die Baureihe DU7179 den dynamischen HDR-Standard HDR10+. Zwar kann entsprechendes Bildmaterial wiedergegeben werden, der sichtbare Effekt des erweiterten Farbraums wird kaum zu erkennen sein aufgrund der niedrigen Spitzenhelligkeit. Dafür können sich Gamer über den Motion Xcelerator freuen. Hierbei übernimmt der ARM-Chipsatz die Zwischenbildberechnung, sodass die nächsten Frames im Voraus berechnet werden, um auch bei schnellen Bewegungen ein klares Bild zu bekommen. Speziell für Gamer lässt sich ALLM aktivieren, um den Inputlag zu reduzieren. Bei der Tonausgabe lässt sich Q Symphony nutzen. Dabei agieren die TV-Lautsprecher als Rückkanal von einer Samsung-Soundbar. So soll sich der schwache Klang hörbar verbessern. Mittels der KI-Techniken der Mustererkennung und Machine Learning funktioniert AI Energy Mode, der das Nutzungsverhalten und die Lichtverhältnisse im Raum analysiert, um die Hintergrundbeleuchtung des DU7179 zu steuern. Diese Funktion, die im Game Mode nicht genutzt werden kann, kann optional aktiviert werden. Aktuell lässt sich auf die Version mit 43 Zoll Bildschirmdiagonale 120 Euro sparen, sodass Amazon-Kunden den Tiefstpreis von nur 429 Euro zahlen. Allerdings handelt es sich dabei um ein befristetes Angebot, das nur für kurze Zeit gültig ist. Noch nie war der aktuelle TV-Jahrgang 2024 so günstig. Zur Fußball-EM 2024 gab es die Baureihe DU7179 kurzzeitig für 435 Euro, laut Hersteller kostet die Einsteiger-Modellreihe mindestens 549 Euro.
Noch mehr sparen: Samsung-TV unter 400 EuroEin smarter Fernseher vom Marktführer Samsung gibt es jedoch auch schon für unter 400 Euro. Hierbei handelt es sich um den wochenlangen Bestseller unter den TVs. In Testberichten weiß der Samsung CU7179 durchaus zu überraschen. Fachredaktionen, wie Hifi.de oder Connect, haben den günstigen Einsteiger-TV Samsung CU7179 bereits unter die Lupe genommen. So ist das Bild farbenfroh und kann bei normalem TV-Programm sogar die QLED-TVs der teureren Baureihe Samsung Q60C überflügeln. Ebenfalls spielt die Zwischenbildberechnung Motion Xcelerator ihre Stärken aus und meistert schnelle Kamerafahrten.So gut der CU7179 bei SDR ist, so schwierig gestaltet sich jedoch die Darstellung von HDR-Inhalten mit erweitertem Farbraum. Hier zeigt sich, dass Samsung an der Bildschirmhelligkeit gespart hat. Maximal kann der LED-TV nur 280 Candela, was zu dunkel für HDR-Inhalte ist, die für gute HDR-Bilder mindestens 500 Candela Helligkeit benötigen. Konsequenterweise unterstützt der Samsung CU7179 keine HDR-Standards. In Kombination mit dem spiegelnden Display müssen Käufer zudem damit rechnen, dass sich in hellen Räumen Gegenstände im TV-Bild spiegeln. Die Tonausgabe ist bassarm, genügt aber fürs herkömmliche TV-Programm. Wer einen günstigen Smart-TV etwa für Schlafzimmer oder Kinderzimmer sucht, bekommt bei Amazon den Samsung CU7179 zum Bestpreis von nur 375 Euro. Damit müssen Interessenten 75 Euro mehr zahlen als zum Tiefstpreis rund um den Black Friday im vergangenen Jahr.Außerdem beliebt bei PCGH-Lesern:Olympia mit sattem Klang erleben - Soundbar Sonos Beam 27 Prozent billiger Zu Olympia 2024 gibt es etwa die ausgezeichnete Sonos Beam 2 mit einem Rabatt von 27 Prozent zu kaufen. Deal: Amazon vs. MediaMarkt: Bestseller FritzRepeater 1200AX zum BestpreisAktuell gibt es nicht nur die AVM FritzBox 7590 AX günstiger, als am Prime Day zu kaufen, sondern auch den FritzRepeater 1200AX günstiger.Beliebte Powerbank über 50 Prozent billiger: Damit iPhone 15, Samsung Galaxy und Co. nicht der Strom ausgeht Bei Amazon gibt es derzeit eine beliebte Powerbank mit einem Rabatt von 50 Prozent zu kaufen. Preis, Daten und Fakten zum Samsung DU7179Bei Amazon gibt es den aktuellen Jahrgang Samsung DU7179 nun zum Tiefstpreis von nur 429 Euro.Die Baureihe DU7179 beherbergt Einsteiger-TVs und ist der Nachfolger der Bestseller-Modellreihe CU7179, die es derzeit ab 375 Euro bei Amazon zu kaufen gibt.Um die Bildverbesserung kümmert sich der neue ARM-Chipsatz namens Crystal Processor 4K, welcher neben 4K Upscaling auch die Zwischenbildberechnung Motion Xcelerator unterstützt. Zudem können sich Gamer über ALLM freuen. Aktuell bietet Amazon den Samsung DU7179 zum Tiefstpreis mit einem Rabatt von 120 Euro an, sodass Kunden nur 429 Euro zahlen. Günstiger war der aktuelle Modelljahrgang noch nie.

# Samsung Confirms That It Is Working On The Exynos 2500, Ensures There Will Be a Stable Supply For Its Up…

[WCCF Tech](https://wccftech.com/samsung-ensures-a-stable-supply-of-exynos-2500-for-flagship-models/)

The Exynos 2500 rumors have been all over the place, with notable analyst Ming-Chi Kuo predicting that next year’s Galaxy S25 launch would exclusively arrive with Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Gen 4 as Samsung’s poor 3nm yields will result in the delay of its flagship SoC. Fortunately, during the Korean giant’s Q2 2024 financial results, the company clarified the chipset’s existence and ensured a stable supply for its upcoming ‘flagship models.’
A previous rumor claimed that Samsung was planning to launch its Galaxy S25 series with the MediaTek 9400 if the Exynos 2500 was delayed further
In its detailed press release, Samsung mentioned the following, stating that the initial response to its 3nm technology has been favorable and ensures that a stable supply of the Exynos 2500 will be available in the future. Do note that before this announcement, the company officially unveiled the Exynos W1000, its first wearable chipset mass produced on the 3nm GAA process, and brings a wide range of performance and efficiency improvements to the table.
“Initial response to the new SoC for wearables, which features the industry’s first 3nm technology, has been favorable and adoption of SoCs featuring this technology by key customers is expected to expand in the second half of the year. The Company also plans to ensure a stable supply of the Exynos 2500 for flagship models.”
While Samsung has attempted to appease readers, investors, and potential customers about its progress on the 3nm node, it has not mentioned the technology’s current yields. A few company executives who attended the Convention & Exhibition Center (COEX) in Seoul earlier this month assured that its 3nm GAA yields were stable, despite reports claiming that those yields stood at an abysmal 20 percent. Since the launch of the Galaxy S24 series, Samsung has consistently aimed for a dual-chipset approach, likely to reduce expenditure caused by relying heavily on Qualcomm’s chipsets.
This is one major reason the company has reportedly chosen to unveil its upcoming Galaxy Tab S10 lineup in October with the Dimensity 9300+ instead of the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3. This move will not only help reduce its chipset expenditure, which was estimated to have reached 18.1 percent of its total smartphone production cost, but also gain bargaining leverage over Qualcomm. So far, the exact performance figures of the Exynos 2500 are unknown, but an earlier rumor claimed its efficiency exceeded Apple’s A15 Bionic, a three-year-old SoC, and ran at higher clock speeds.
Before the Exynos 2500 launch, we hope to learn something about it and how Samsung’s 3nm GAA process has been progressing. While the company made the right decision by publicly announcing its existence, a ton of information is currently in the dark.

# Google Gemini Advanced Review: Don't Cancel Your ChatGPT Plus Subscription

[CNET News](https://www.cnet.com/tech/services-and-software/google-gemini-advanced-review-dont-cancel-your-chatgpt-plus-subscription/#ftag=CAD590a51e)

Basic info:Price: $20 per monthAvailability: Web or mobile appFeatures: Voice recognition, memory retention, high token count, cross-check with Google Search, connection to open internet with up-to-date informationImage generation: yesTwo years into the AI revolution and Google is still fumbling. When Google was caught flat-footed by the release of ChatGPT in late 2022, that reportedly caused a code red within the company, and it rushed to get a competing AI chatbot out the door. At the time, it was named Bard, and the launch didn't go smoothly. It immediately made errors, leading to a massive drop in Google's stock price. Since then, Google's AI efforts have continued to stumble, with the company having to respond to multiple embarrassments. This includes generating images in Gemini, renamed from Bard, of people of color portrayed as Nazis, or its AI Overviews feature in Search telling people to eat rocks or put glue on pizza. But these foibles have largely been limited to Google's free AI offerings. With Gemini Advanced, which runs on the Gemini 1.5 Pro model, Google says it's more powerful and has better understanding. At Google I/O earlier this year, the company touted that it will have a context window of 2 million tokens. That means you could paste a 3,000-page document and Gemini can parse through all of it. But being able to handle a lot of data doesn't mean Gemini can use that data correctly. Even with the improvements to Gemini Advanced, we still found glaring errors in the paid version of Google's chatbot. It's a problem that plagued the free version as well. At least Gemini Advanced has the Double Check feature, which cross-references answers with Google Search results. It does raise the question: Why can't Gemini integrate Google cross-checking within its answer stack? At $20 per month, which is the same price as ChatGPT Plus, Google's failing to deliver on a competitor that can dethrone OpenAI.How CNET tests AI chatbotsCNET takes a practical approach to reviewing AI chatbots. By prompting AI chatbots with real-world scenarios, like finding and modifying recipes, researching travel, and writing emails, my fellow reviewers and I aim to simulate what the average person might use them for. The goal isn't to break AI chatbots with bizarre riddles or logic problems. Instead, we look to see if real questions prompt useful and accurate answers. However, as more advanced models are released, it'll require more advanced-level questioning to see how AI chatbots can reason with complex and multilayered topics. See our page on how we test AI for more.When using Gemini Advanced, keep in mind that the service automatically collects the information you put into its system, so be mindful of giving the service any personal information. Google recommends not feeding Gemini any sensitive information whatsoever. For more information, see Google's privacy policy.ShoppingIt's reasonable to expect that when using a paid AI chatbot for shopping recommendations it should get basic information correct. Well, that's expecting too much from Google Gemini. Or maybe that's expecting too much from AI chatbots in general, at least for recently released products.When trying to compare the newly released Motorola Razr Plus 2024 and the Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6, Gemini got key bits of information wrong, bits that could greatly affect your purchasing decision. This includes basic information, like claiming the Razr Plus has a smaller display than the Z Flip 6, when in reality it's the other way around. Or that the Z Flip 6 is bulkier than the Razr when folded, whereas it's actually slimmer. Gemini even failed to get the processor specifications correct on both devices. Thankfully, Gemini does have a double-check option that lets you cross-reference Google Search to ensure the answer is correct. The problem is, how would a person know to double check? Is it best to double check on all queries? If the user doesn't know the information is wrong, then how will they know to click on Double Check?Granted, when asking ChatGPT similar questions about the Razr Plus and Z Flip 6, it too got lots of information wrong. Even though ChatGPT 4o and Gemini Advanced are connected to the open internet, both systems need some fine tuning for how they parse through relatively recent bits of information. As for comparing products that are a year old, Gemini did a much better job of getting information right. I asked it to compare the LG OLED C3 and G3 TVs, and Gemini got all the little factoids correct. This suggests that it takes time for AI chatbots to ascertain and funnel information into their datasets. So, whether you're using Gemini Advanced or ChatGPT Plus, for newer items, a Google Search might be your best bet.RecipesAll chatbots, including the free ones, do a good job of conjuring up recipes. Some might perform better than others but all are adequate. When reviewing free AI chatbots like ChatGPT 3.5, Claude and even the base Gemini, I had no issues with having recipes generated. Weirdly, Gemini Advanced glitched out for what should have been a straightforward recipe query. Why it did so, I'm not sure.   Google Gemini Advanced unable to answer basic recipe questions. CNETWhen I tried asking it again, it began generating the recipe only to then delete it and say, "I'm not programmed to assist with that." Bizarre.I thought maybe Gemini has an aversion to South Asian food. I then asked it to make me a Thai-inspired tres leches cake, mixing the flavors of Mexico and Southeast Asia. Even here, it began generating a page-long recipe for it to suddenly disappear and say it's unable to process that. After a second try, it finally generated a recipe. The recipe itself seemed fine but a bit lacking. The only Thai ingredients were Thai tea and some shredded coconut. Some lime zest or cardamom would have been nice additions.So when Gemini Advanced works, it's a decent recipe builder. But it might be easier and better to defer to a dedicated recipe website.Summarizing articlesWhether it be Microsoft, OpenAI or Google, all have touted AI's capabilities to synthesize and summarize information. Long emails can quickly be condensed to a few sentences with the key parts pulled out. A research paper can be shrunk down to one page for quick viewing. Sure, a summary won't give you the full scope of what a 30-page research paper would. But in a pinch, it's handy. At the very least, AI chatbots should do a decent job of summarizing a short article to get all the key points. Weirdly, this has been a difficult task for the free AI chatbots. They'd either run into character limits or get some of the underlying points but miss the bigger picture. Just like with my recipe test above, Gemini failed to summarize an article I wrote, saying it can't access CNET.   Instance of Google Gemini Advanced not being able to summarize an article that's being linked to.  CNETBut when I simply pasted the link without prompting Gemini to "summarize this article for me," it actually did return a few bullet points. Why the shift in response between prompted and promptless is lost on me.    Instance of Google Gemini Advanced summarizing a CNET article. CNETWhile I technically didn't prompt Gemini to summarize my article in this instance, it still did so anyway. Honestly, the breakdown isn't bad. It got the main points and even got the crux of the piece. According to Jon Henshaw, CNET's vice president of audience, our site isn't blocking Google from crawling it. CNET doesn't allow Google to train its LLMs with our journalism, however. TravelAs a travel planning tool, Gemini Advanced does a great job of building a robust itinerary. The test isn't notably difficult: creating a three-day travel itinerary to Columbus, Ohio. While it's not the most traveled-to destination, it's still unconventional enough where we feel it would mildly challenge AI chatbots.The advantage with Gemini Advanced is that it's connected to the open internet. When running this test on free AI chatbots, like ChatGPT 3.5 to Claude, which have older datasets, sometimes it'd pull up restaurant recommendations for locations that have since closed. This hasn't been a problem for Gemini Advanced in our testing.What's also handy is that Gemini Advanced is linked with Google Maps. Meaning, I could ask Gemini for retro video game store recommendations and it'd pull up a map of five stores around the Columbus area. It gives Gemini Advanced a leg up over the competition.The inclusion of articles to sites like Tripadvisor, along with pictures so you could see what things look like without leaving Gemini, was certainly an appreciated feature.Now, since this isn't the most demanding test of an AI chatbot, the free version of Gemini produces similar results and also links to Google Maps. While Gemini's travel recommendation functionality is solid, it's not worth the $20 per month for this function alone. High-level thinkingWhen reviewing ChatGPT 4 earlier this year, we tried to push its cognitive capabilities by asking philosophically obscure questions requiring it to juggle different schools of thought from past philosophers while simultaneously putting it in a modern technological framework. You could say it was a bit absurd. Given the obtuse wording, we were surprised at how well ChatGPT 4 was able to handle our jumble of philosophical jargon. Gemini Advanced, in comparison, reads like a Bart Simpson book report, with its only knowledge of the source material being the cover art alone. What's worse, Gemini instead suggested what I should Google search instead to learn more. The constant return to Google Search sums up the experience with Gemini Advanced rather succinctly.If you must spend $20 on an AI chatbot, Gemini Advanced isn't itLike the free version of Google Gemini, the paid Gemini Advanced isn't worth your time or attention. It's bizarre how poor Gemini Advanced is when Google is the company that funded much of the neural network technology powering the AI revolution. While Gemini Advanced works adequately in answering basic questions, it starts to fall apart when pushing it for novel information analysis. Heck, it'll start falling apart when asking basic questions too. The fact that Gemini glitched out multiple times when generating something as simple as a recipe makes the product feel unfinished. It echoes Google's past blunders with AI and feels as if the company pushed out a product before it was ready. To put it bluntly, don't waste your money on Gemini Advanced. ChatGPT Plus is simply better. It's smarter and more accurate. The only area where ChatGPT really loses out against Gemini Advanced is its token count. You can paste in text only up to 4,096 tokens, or about 3,000 words. That pales in comparison with the 1 million context tokens that can be entered into Gemini Advanced. That said, most people won't be pasting entire novels into AI chatbots. Unless you have one particular use case that only Gemini can fulfill, ChatGPT Plus is the better option on all counts.

# Für LGA1700-CPUs: Die besten Intel-Mainboards vor Core Ultra 200

[PC Games Hardware](https://www.pcgameshardware.de/Mainboard-Hardware-154107/Tests/Mainboard-Vergleich-Intel-1700-1200-1386178/)

Mainboard
Kaufberatung Intel-Mainboards: LGA1700-Gaming-Platinen für Core-CPUs [August 2024]
Kaufberatung und -Vergleich auf Basis der PCGH-Bestenliste für Intel-Mainboards, namentlich dem Sockel 1700, aber auch mit Blick auf älteren Plattformen und LGA4677: Egal ob Asus, MSI, Asrock, Gigabyte oder ein anderer Hersteller - mit unseren Tipps finden Sie die richtige Hauptplatine.

31.07.2024 um 10:15 Uhr
Quelle: PC Games Hardware
Aktuelle Änderungen hervorheben
In diesem ArtikelSeite 1 Mainboard-Kaufempfehlungen 2024 - Beratung für Intel-Plattformen anhand von PCGH-TestergebnissenSeite 2 Mainboard-Kaufempfehlungen 2024 - Intel: Sockel 1700Seite 3 Archiv-StartseiteSeite 4 Mainboard-Empfehlungsarchiv - Intel: Sockel 1200Seite 5 Mainboard-Empfehlungsarchiv - Intel: Sockel 1151 (CFL)Seite 6 Mainboard-Empfehlungsarchiv - Intel: Sockel 2066Seite 7 Bildergalerie zu "Für LGA1700-CPUs: Die besten Intel-Mainboards vor Core Ultra 200"
 Ein System aufzurüsten oder neu zu kaufen, kann ein Vermögen kosten - wenn man eine neue Grafikkarte braucht. Gerade Intel-Motherboards, auf die wir uns in diesem Artikel konzentrieren, werden dagegen zu recht attraktiven Preisen angeboten. Parallel pflegen wir eine AMD-Mainboard-Kaufberatung mit AM5-Kauftipps; beide Artikel werden regelmäßig auf Basis unserer umfangreichen Vergleichstests aus den PCGH-Heften aktualisiert. Zur Heftbestellung im PCGH-Shop.Zusätzlich gehen wir an dieser Stelle auf Preisentwicklung, neue Gerüchte und Zukunftserwartungen der jeweiligen Plattform ein. Einen Hersteller- und Generationen-übergreifenden Überblick zu letzteren pflegen wir in unserer Plattform-Übersicht.Aktualisierung, August 2024: Nach Umstellung des CPU-Testparcours wurden die Sockel-1700-Beschreibung aktualisiert und die Nachfolgegerüchte im Zuge der Computex neu einsortiert.Intel-Prozessoren und -Mainboards allgemeinFormell waren Intels Desktop-Plattformen vom Ende der 0er- bis Anfang der 20er-Jahre in eine Mainstream- und in eine Enthusiast-Sparte geteilt. Die Sockel "Sockel 115X" 1156, 1155, 1150, 1151 (SKL) und 1151 (CFL) zusammen mit dem 1200 boten die gesamte Zeit über 16 PCI-Express-Lanes zwischen CPU und Grafikkarte(n) sowie zwei Arbeitsspeicherkanäle. Deren Geschwindigkeit wurde mehrfach gesteigert, die quantitative Schnittstellen-Ausstattung der Prozessoren blieb dagegen ebenso begrenzt wie die Zahl der Rechenkerne, auch wenn es öfter für echte High-End-Produkte reichte. Die verwirrender Weise "HEDT" (High End Desktop) abgekürzten Enthusiast-Plattformen LGA1366, -2011, -2011-v3 und -2066 lieferten hingegen 1,5- bis 3-mal so viele Kerne, Speicherkanäle und CPU-seitige PCI-E-Lanes wie ihre zeitgenössischen Mainstream-Genossen. Sie waren pro Kern aber oft etwas langsamer und allgemein deutlich teurer. Nach dem Abschied von PCI-E-hungrigen Multi-GPU-Setups sowie mit zunehmender Kernanzahl im Mainstream-Bereich wurde dieses Produktsparte zunehmend überflüssig.

Werbung: So finden Sie das beste Mainboard für Ihren PC
Quelle: PC Games Hardware
Der Sockel 1700 ist leet - behauptet nicht nur die Seriennummer der auf einigen Asus-Mainboards installierten ILM-Loadplate.
Formell hat Intel das Ende des Sockel 2066 zwar erst nach 6 Jahren, im Juli 2023, angekündigt, in der Praxis wurde die längst vollkommen veraltete Plattform schon lange vorher von neueren Mainstream-Lösungen aus dem Markt gedrängt. Der aktuelle Sockel 1700 deckt daher den gesamten Desktop- inklusive Enthusiast-Bereich ab, sowohl bezüglich der verfügbaren Leistung als auch Ausstattung. Die 2023 eingeführte LGA4677-Plattform mit Xeon-W-CPUs auf Sapphire-Rapids-Basis führt zwar insbesondere in der kleineren W-2400-Ausbau-Stufe die alte HEDT-Tradition mit circa zwei- bis dreimal so vielen Speicherkanälen, Kernen und PCI-E-Lanes fort, sie wird aber nur noch als Workstation-Xeon vermarktet.
 Intel geht davon aus, dass Desktop-Anwender in der Regel keinen Bedarf an so viel parallelisierter Leistung haben und wir schließen uns dem an; konzentrieren unsere Beratung auf den LGA1700. Konkurrent AMD vermarktet zwar, nach vierjähriger Pause, wieder Teile der neuen TR5-Plattform als "HEDT", aber nicht einmal die Hersteller-eigenen Benchmarks geschweige denn unsere Testergebnisse lassen Threadripper 7000 für Heimanwender attraktiv erscheinen. Preise, Mainboards und die nur in gut parallelisierbaren Anwendungen ansprechende (dann aber überragende) Leistung schreien ebenso "Workstation" wie AMDs explizite Nennung des LGA4677-Vollausbaus Xeon W-3400 (bis zu 56 Kerne, viermal so viele RAM-Kanäle wie im Desktop und bis zu 112 PCI-E-5.0-Lanes) als Hauptkonkurrent. Desktop-Plattformen oberhalb der Mainstream-Sockel sind und bleiben somit tot. Tatsächlich vernachlässigt Intel mittlerweile sogar schon das "W"-Segment - wer den Sapphire-Rapids-Nachfolger Emerald Rapids nutzen möchte, muss in Ermangelung eines Xeon-W-Refreshs die gegen AMDs Epyc platzierten "Scalable"-Modelle in seiner Workstation verbauen. Umgekehrt basieren Entry-Level-Server-Angebote (Xeon E-2400) mittlerweile auf Sockel-1700-Raptor-Lake-Technik.

# Game Pass August 2024 Lineup Just Got Leaked

[WCCF Tech](https://wccftech.com/game-pass-august-2024-lineup-just-got-leaked/)

Following earlier rumors, leaker extas1s has now shared a partial Game Pass lineup for the month of August. Most of the games were previously leaked, but now we have dates. Deck13's Action RPG Atlas Fallen, for instance, will land on Microsoft's subscription service on August 13, exactly one week after the launch of the Reign of Sand update, which is aiming to vastly improve the game in various areas thanks to brand new voice acting, new areas, new enemies, new Essence Stones, a New Game Plus mode, and quality-of-life improvements.
Activision Blizzard's Crash N.Sane Trilogy was also rumored to join Game Pass. According to extas1s, the remastered collection of the beloved platform franchise will be released on the subscription service on Thursday, August 8.
Just five days later, Game Pass subscribers will get Mafia Definitive Edition, the remake of the classic open world game that marked the beginning of the franchise. 2K has since confirmed the previous rumor, so this addition is actually official now.
These are the biggest new games coming in the month of the August, but there's more on the way. The wave begins on August 6 with SOPA - Tale of the Stolen Potato, an indie adventure game set in South America. The following day, Game Pass users will get to play Creatures of Ava, a so-called creature saver game where players traverse an alien planet, solving environmental challenges and rescuing the native creatures from an infection called 'withering'.
On August 15, the leaked schedule says the subscription service will be updated with Wargroove 2, Chucklefish's acclaimed turn-based tactics sequel released in October 2023. Last but not least, Pugstorm's Core Keeper will be added on Tuesday, August 27. Core Keeper is a 'mining sandbox adventure' game released in March 2022 via early access. It is set in a procedurally generated underground world, borrowing mechanics from the likes of Stardew Valley, Terraria, and Minecraft.
This appears to be the full August Game Pass slate, although extas1s previously said Spyro Reignited Trilogy and Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1+2 are also coming soon to the subscription service. Moreover, Grand Theft Auto V might join PC Game Pass in the near future. Of course, the biggest recent addition was the launch of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III.
Does this lineup convince you to subscribe, following the recent price increase?

# Dating Apps Think AI Will Stop Swiping Burnout. It Might Make It Worse

[CNET News](https://www.cnet.com/tech/services-and-software/dating-apps-think-ai-will-stop-swiping-burnout-it-might-make-it-worse/#ftag=CAD590a51e)

Generative AI will be a chance for dating apps to show they've learned from past mistakes -- if they take it.
       Katelyn is an associate writer with CNET covering social media and online services. She graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill with a degree in media and journalism. You can often find her with a paperback and an iced coffee during her time off.   There's never been a worse time to be on dating apps. Or there's never been a better time. It all depends on how you feel about AI.Dating apps are no strangers to artificial intelligence. But given online dating companies' years of experience in AI tech, it's a welcome surprise that they don't seem inclined to immediately flood their apps with new, ChatGPT-like features, unlike other social platforms.       The leading companies are taking different approaches. Match Group, which owns many dating apps including Tinder and Hinge, has focused more on profile-building and chat tools. Meanwhile, Bumble, the next largest player, has been investing in AI for fraud and spam detection and is a founding member of Partnership for AI, a coalition of media, tech and activist organizations urging for responsible use of "synthetic" or AI-generated media.Generative AI and other advances come at a challenging time for the $3 billion online dating industry. User growth has stalled over the last several years. People using the apps are reporting high levels of dating app burnout, according to a study by Forbes. People are exhausted from endless swiping, awkward conversations that don't go anywhere and ghosting. A recent class action lawsuit alleges Match Group is "gameifying" dating apps to keep people swiping instead of finding suitable matches. There are also enduring concerns about data privacy and safety, as romance scams attempt to drain our wallets and data breaches risk our personal data. Only 30% of Americans feel safe while using dating apps, according to a 2024 report from HR tech company Checkr. In many ways, the adoption of generative AI will be a crucial test for the industry -- will companies learn from past mistakes and use the new technology to fix years-long pain points and ease feelings of burnout? Or will the adoption of AI exacerbate existing concerns about privacy and ultimately make things worse? The answer will lie in how the apps plan on using AI and how much control they will give us over it. Swiping right on AINowadays, AI-powered algorithms drive every major dating app. But that wasn't always how online dating worked. Originally, online dating was targeted primarily to older audiences and required them to fill out long questionnaires about their interests, hobbies and preferences. Then came Tinder."Swiping changed the online dating game … a little over a decade ago, and it was transformative," said Liesel Sharabi, an associate professor at Arizona State University and online dating researcher. Swiping models use foundational AI technology from fields like machine learning to develop personalized recommendations. These exist in many places online, powering things like how Netflix recommends a new show or how TikTok serves videos. When people use dating apps, every action they make is a data point for the algorithms to determine what content to serve next. When people fill out their preferences and actively swipe, it helps the algorithm learn what content they're most likely to engage with and what profiles make the best potential matches. "When you swipe right on somebody to indicate that you like them, it's going to take into account other people who have also been swiping right on the same profiles, and it's going to use that information to then make recommendations. So it's recommending partners based on people like you who seem to have similar tastes," said Sharabi in a Zoom interview.Many dating apps also use non-generative AI tools to bolster their security. In 2019, Bumble rolled out an AI-powered image detector that automatically recognized and blurred nonconsensual nudes sent in chats. In 2021, Tinder introduced a tool that scans people's DM drafts to identify inappropriate language and sends them a pop-up message asking them to reconsider sending. More recently, Hinge created an anti-ghosting feature that prompts you to reply to existing matches, in an attempt to help mitigate burnout.Now, the next evolution of AI technology is here in the form of generative AI. It's the kind of technology that powers popular chatbots like ChatGPT and can create text, images and audio from simple queries. It also presents a lot of opportunities for dating apps to improve their models. Sharabi said that dating app users are in a "burnout era.""People are getting burnt out. They're tired of the model that exists currently. I think we're at a point where people are ready for some changes, and fortunately for the platforms, I think AI is going to bring that," Sharabi said.Leveling up your rizz with generative AIAt a tech event hosted by Bloomberg this past spring, Bumble founder Whitney Wolfe Herd said she saw a future where AI personas acted like concierges to swipe, match and message with other people's AIs for us. That future is still a ways off in terms of technological development and implementation, but generative AI for dating apps is here.So far, AI features on dating apps are falling into two main buckets: tools to bolster security and tools to improve engagement. Tinder recently launched an AI-powered photo selector tool, which scans your camera roll for the best pictures to include on your profile. In the other bucket, Bumble recently announced a new AI model that it says strengthens its ability to weed out fake, scam or spam accounts. Bumble's deception detector tool, powered by the AI model, helps people report fake profiles using AI-generated photos and videos.Generative AI has also opened the doors for AI dating startups like Rizz Decode. Rizz is an AI-powered dating assistant that uses ChatGPT and other models to generate text for dating apps. You can upload screenshots from dating apps to the Rizz mobile app, and it will suggest replies based on what's being discussed in the DM or on someone's profile. The app, which is available for $10 a week, currently has over 7 million users and has generated over 75 million responses.   Rizz uses generative AI to come up with opening lines to use in dating apps. Screenshot by Katelyn ChedraouiWhen ChatGPT exploded in popularity in 2022, Rizz co-founder Roman Khaves saw the tech as a great opportunity to help improve the experience of using the big dating apps and, most importantly, help folks get off the apps and go on a date. One of the biggest features Rizz offers is aid in crafting an opening line, which is a make-or-break moment, Khaves said. "It's challenging to start a conversation," Khaves said in an interview. "It's also not really something [people] are used to in real life … Rizz makes it easier to have and start conversations."People using Rizz definitely run the risk that their match might not appreciate learning they used AI to connect with them. But Khaves pointed out that Rizz's goal is to help people get past the all-too-common talking phase and avoid ghosting. "We offer suggestions; we don't tell you exactly which line to write," said Khaves. "Everyone is choosing a very different line. So what we do is we help give you the strategy, then we offer different examples." Rizz also lets you insert keywords, so if you want to appeal to a potential match's love of sushi and dancing, Rizz can come up with different examples of opening lines based on those interests.While Rizz's ultimate goal is to get you off dating apps, not every use of AI tech for online dating is so benign. A London-based lesbian dating app recently made news for adding facial recognition to its verification process. According to the app's founder, the tech can identify specific appearance characteristics that aid in the app's overall goal to purposefully exclude trans women from accessing the platform. Like any technology, the potential benefits or harms AI can cause depend on how it is used.New AI tools, old concerns renewedWhere AI goes, privacy concerns follow. For people on dating apps, that's nothing new. Dating apps encourage you to share as much personal information as possible so the algorithm can find the most compatible matches. But that comes with inherent safety risks, whether it's being more vulnerable to scammers, app-wide data breaches or having your information shared and used by third parties.Match Group has a set of guiding principles for generative AI, including a promise to be "transparent about how we use data to improve generative AI outcomes." As of publication, in Tinder and Hinge's privacy policies, AI isn't mentioned once. The apps don't have specific policies laying out how AI is used. Hinge does have its own AI principles, which make a similar promise to its parent company about using AI safely and responsibly. Hinge said in the principles that it does not use generative AI, though it is exploring future integrations, which was confirmed in Match Group's first-quarter earning report. For both Tinder and Hinge, the only way to delete all your data is by submitting a request and closing your account. Bumble also doesn't have an AI policy, and its privacy policy doesn't mention AI either. For companies that are beginning to roll out more AI features, not having specific AI policies or updating their privacy policies is worrisome. It's especially concerning considering how terrible dating apps have been at protecting their users' personal information in the past. "A lot of the companies are using that information not just to help you find love, but to help them make money," said Jen Caltrider, program director of the Privacy Not Included project at Mozilla Foundation. The project evaluated 25 of the most popular dating apps, and over half failed to meet minimum security standards. Most dating apps (80%) have policies for sharing or selling personal information with advertisers, and Caltrider's team tagged 88% with a privacy and security warning label. Their concern is that generative AI will make apps more data-hungry.   These are the worst dating apps in terms of privacy according to the Privacy Not Included project. Screenshot by Katelyn Chedraoui/CNETGrindr is one example of an app that could be affected by AI. CEO George Arison has been vocal about the possibilities AI presents, and Grindr said in a blog post it was exploring new ways to use generative AI, without giving any specifics. Arison said in an interview with Yahoo Finance earlier this year that one way AI could change how matches are made is by potentially scanning people's DMs for additional data to improve match recommendations. Grindr has not implemented this tool, but it has updated its privacy policy to say it's transitioning the storage of messaging info to Grindr servers, no longer just on people's devices. If you use Grindr, you now have to trust it with personal information, Caltrider said, and the company doesn't have the best track record with that. Right now in the UK, Grindr is facing a big lawsuit from people who allege that Grindr shared their sensitive health information, including HIV status, without their consent. In a case from 2021, a Catholic media company bought location-tracking data from dating apps like Grindr, which reportedly led to the outing of a priest. "It's not only what you can read and deduce from [dating apps] policy privacy documentation. It's also what they then turn around and actually do," said Caltrider. "Trusting them with your information is trust that I feel a lot of these dating app companies have not earned." Adding AI to the mix could make it even harder to trust dating apps with our information. The rise of AI chatbots and generators has brought up many privacy and even copyright concerns, particularly around how models are trained. Big players like OpenAI have struck deals with news organizations and platforms like Reddit to use their content for training purposes. However, dating apps have been more hush-hush about their processes -- including whether user data is used. Khaves said that all screenshots on Rizz are encrypted and added that part of being on dating apps, and even other social platforms like Facebook, means forfeiting some degree of privacy. For example, Tinder simply won't work if people don't share their location. But when it comes to potential new AI tools, it's going to be harder to decide to hand over data if you don't have information about how it's actually used -- if you get the choice at all. Generative AI on dating apps also raises new, thorny ethical questions. For example, if a dating app did start scanning DMs for data, is that something its users consent to and control? And if AI tools include human review as part of the maintenance process, are people aware of and agreeing to have their DMs potentially read by someone other than their match? Ethical questions like these, Caltrider said, are ones dating apps might not be considering as they rush to get into the AI game.As dating apps dive deeper into AI, all of these unknowns will affect the quality of the user experience. AI promises opportunities for dating apps to improve their services and security. But it's also likely to further cement a key issue -- forcing people to give up personal information and forfeit privacy in the name of finding love."It becomes really tricky to implement AI successfully in a situation where every bit of personal information about you is on the table," said Caltrider.Future of AI in online datingSo far, new AI dating tools seem to be focused on reversing negative trends and improving the experience for daters. But there's still a worrisome lack of information about how these models will be used and whether user data is involved in creating and training them.There's also the distinct possibility that all these AI tools eventually end up paywalled, accessible only to premium subscribers. A report from Morgan Stanley highlighted that monetization of people who are already using the apps -- getting them to upgrade and pay for certain perks like standing out, unlocking more matches and sending unlimited likes -- is likely going to be the industry's strategy for the next few years. If that is the eventual end goal for Match Group and Bumble, they're going to have to work to prove these AI features will be worth it.On the other end of the spectrum, Sharabi wonders if AI might push people back to meeting more folks in real life. With AI tools becoming more common, it could be harder for people to trust they're safe and not being catfished. AI should augment, not replace, human decision-making, she said."Dating apps, they're fun and kind of frivolous, but at the same time, they're also facilitating some of the most important decisions that you will ever make. People are using them to choose life partners. It's a huge decision. It's going to impact so many different aspects of your life, and we're letting AI help us make those choices. It's really significant," Sharabi said.

# Quali sono gli operatori mobile e fissi più veloci in Italia? I risultati del report di Ookla

[HW Upgrade](https://www.hwupgrade.it/news/telefonia/quali-sono-gli-operatori-mobile-e-fissi-piu-veloci-in-italia-i-risultati-del-report-di-ookla_129419.html)

Nel panorama delle telecomunicazioni italiane, il primo semestre del 2024 ha visto emergere diversi leader di mercato nel settore mobile e in quello della connettività fissa. Secondo l'ultimo Speedtest Connectivity Report di Ookla, basato su milioni di test giornalieri effettuati dai consumatori, Fastweb si è distinta come l'operatore mobile più veloce, mentre Iliad ha conquistato il primato nel settore della banda larga fissa.
I risultati del settore mobile
Fastweb ha registrato una velocità di download mediana di 122,53 Mbps prendendo come riferimento tutte le tecnologie di rete combinate. WINDTRE si è piazzata al secondo posto con 83,47 Mbps, seguita da Vodafone con 81,91 Mbps. Le prestazioni di Fastweb non si limitano alla velocità di download: l'operatore ha anche ottenuto risultati notevoli nella velocità di upload (13,41 Mbps) e nella latenza (58 ms).
Nel campo del 5G è Vodafone a guidare la classifica. L'operatore ha ottenuto lo Speed Score più alto (206,42) e la velocità di download mediana più elevata (244,63 Mbps) sulle reti di quinta generazione. Fastweb si è posizionata al secondo posto con 148,69 Mbps, seguita da TIM con 129,16 Mbps. Vodafone ha primeggiato anche nella velocità di upload 5G (20,29 Mbps) e nella latenza (43 ms). Nell'ambito della disponibilità del 5G, WINDTRE ha superato la concorrenza: il 63,5% dei suoi utenti con tariffe 5G ha trascorso la maggior parte del tempo connesso alla rete di nuova generazione. Fastweb si è classificata seconda, con una disponibilità del 49,5%.
Per quanto riguarda l'esperienza di gioco su mobile, Vodafone ha conquistato il primo posto sia sulla rete generale che sul 5G. L'operatore ha ottenuto un Game Score di 83,42 sulla rete complessiva e di 87,94 sul 5G, con una latenza mediana di 60 ms verso i principali server di gioco.
I risultati degli altri settori
Passando al settore della connettività fissa, Iliad ha dimostrato una netta superiorità rispetto alla concorrenza, agevolata dal fatto che offre principalmente reti a banda ultra larga. L'operatore ha registrato una velocità di download mediana di 343,27 Mbps, distanziando notevolmente il secondo classificato, Sky, fermo a 93,84 Mbps. Iliad ha primeggiato anche nella velocità di upload (238,77 Mbps) e nell'esperienza video (Video Score di 89,78). Sky, tuttavia, ha ottenuto la latenza più bassa del mercato (18 ms).
Le prestazioni di Iliad nel settore fisso non si limitano alla velocità. L'operatore ha dimostrato anche un'eccellente consistenza di rete, con il 93,4% dei test che hanno soddisfatto o superato la soglia di 25 Mbps in download e 3 Mbps in upload. Inoltre, Iliad ha offerto la migliore esperienza di gioco tra gli operatori italiani, con un Game Score di 92,89 e una latenza mediana di 63 ms verso i principali server di gioco. Il rapporto ha evidenziato anche le prestazioni delle connessioni nelle principali città italiane.
Bari si è distinta per la velocità di download mobile più elevata (87,57 Mbps), mentre Genova ha primeggiato nella connettività fissa con 248,49 Mbps. Un dato interessante riguarda EOLO, operatore specializzato in connessioni Fixed Wireless Access (FWA): nonostante non possa competere con le prestazioni di Iliad, EOLO ha registrato un significativo aumento della velocità mediana, passando da 30,29 Mbps nel secondo semestre 2023 a 40,08 Mbps nel primo semestre 2024. Un miglioramento che sottolinea la crescente domanda di connettività avanzata nelle aree rurali italiane.
Lo Speedtest Connectivity Report di Ookla offre uno spaccato dettagliato del mercato delle telecomunicazioni italiano, evidenziando non solo le prestazioni pure in termini di velocità, ma anche aspetti cruciali come la consistenza della rete, l'esperienza di gioco e video, e la soddisfazione degli utenti. La metodologia di Speedtest si basa su test avviati dagli utenti, riflettendo l'esperienza reale di connessione internet dei consumatori. Ookla dispone di una enorme rete di server di test al mondo, distribuiti in ogni paese e nei principali centri abitati. Questa capillare distribuzione elimina i tempi di latenza aggiuntivi dovuti alla distanza tra dispositivo e server, garantendo misurazioni in ogni caso precise della velocità di rete effettiva. Oltre ai test avviati dagli utenti, Ookla raccoglie quotidianamente miliardi di campioni dalle reti mobili, misurando i livelli del segnale radio, la copertura e la disponibilità della rete, nonché parametri di qualità dell'esperienza per varie attività online come streaming video, videoconferenze, gaming e navigazione web. Questi dati vengono poi sottoposti a rigorosi processi di aggregazione e analisi, assicurando che le misurazioni riflettano con precisione l'esperienza di rete reale dei consumatori. Il report può essere trovato per intero qui, sul sito ufficiale Ookla.

      riscatto.

        evento di questo genere. In precedenza l'asticella era stata fissata
      a 40 milioni di dollari, pagati dal colosso assicurativo CNA a seguito di
      un attacco el gruppo ransomware Evil Corp. Anche Chainalysis, una società
      specializzata in intelligence crittografica, ha dato conferma su X del
      pagamento. Il nuovo record fissa, purtroppo, un precedente a cui molti
        altri attori di minaccia potrebbero ispirarsi nelle loro future campagne
        criminali e di estorsione. 
    
    
      
        We can confirm that early this year we saw the
          largest ransomware payment ever at $75M. The "big game hunting" trend
          we discussed in our 2024 crime report – fewer attacks on larger
          targets with deeper pockets – is becoming more pronounced. https://t.co/Z0yvg3Zvp2
          pic.twitter.com/4FsivojtA5
        — Chainalysis (@chainalysis) July
          30, 2024
      
    
    Dark Angels è un gruppo ransomware che ha iniziato le proprie attività
      nel mese di maggio del 2022, sfruttando inizialmente i crittografi basati
      sul codice sorgente del ransomware Babuk. In seguito il gruppo ha adottato
      un crittografo Linux, lo stesso usato dal ransomware Ragnar Locker fino a
      quando non è stato smantellato nel corso del 2023. Con questo crittografo
      Dark Angels ha sferrato un attacco a Johnson Controls, con il furto di
        27TB di dati aziendali e la richiesta di 51 milioni di dollari di
        riscatto. 
    Lo schema operativo di Dark Angels è comune a quello adottato da altri
      gruppi ransomware che mirano esclusivamente ad estorcere denaro.
      Individuato l'obiettivo, il primo passo è quello della violazione della
        rete aziendale, spesso prendendo di mira un endpoint scarsamente
      protetto o tramite tecniche più sofisticate di ingegneria sociale. Una
      volta ottenuto l'accesso, il gruppo si sposta lateralmente sulla rete fino
      a quando non riesce a compromettere e prendere il controllo di un account
      con permessi di amministratore. In questa fase vengono inoltre sottratte
      informazioni dai sistemi compromessi, che vengono utilizzati come leva
      aggiuntiva alla presentazione della richiesta di riscatto. Dopo aver preso
      il controllo di un account amministrativo, si procede alla distribuzione
      del ransomware sulla rete aziendale, allo scopo di crittografare tutti i
      dispositivi collegati. A questo punto scatta lo schema a doppia
      estorsione: Dark Angels pubblica sul proprio sito "Dunghill Leaks" la
      minaccia di divulgazione rivolta alla vittima, chiedendo un riscatto e,
      appunto, minacciando di condividere i dati nel caso in cui la vittima
      dovesse decidere di non pagare. 
    Zscaler ThreatLabz osserva
      che Dark Angels procede in maniera meticolosa concentrandosi su una
      singola azienda alla volta, al contrario di quanto operato da altri gruppi
      ransomware che spesso operano parallelamente contro più vittime. Inoltre il
        gruppo opera secondo una strategia chiamata "Big Game Hunting", dove
      prende di mira poche aziende ad alto valore, puntando a pagamenti
      sostanziosi, invece di attaccare piccole realtà e riscuotere numerosi
      riscatti di relativamente bassa entità. Questa strategia sembra essere una
      tendenza via via crescente nel corso degli ultimi anni, adottata dai
      gruppi ransomware di alto profilo, come riscontrato anche da Chainalysis.

# 22 Grill and BBQ Tools You Won't Regret Buying

[CNET News](https://www.cnet.com/home/yard-and-outdoors/best-grill-tools-to-buy-for-summer/#ftag=CAD590a51e)

Article updated on July 31, 2024 at 4:11 AM PDT
          
    Get your grilling game in gear with these gadgets that are worth every penny. 
        Our expert, award-winning staff selects the products we cover and rigorously researches and tests our top picks. If you buy through our links, we may get a commission.
      Reviews ethics statement
          David Watsky Senior Editor / Home and Kitchen David lives in Brooklyn where he's spent more than a decade covering all things edible, including meal kit services, food subscriptions, kitchen tools and cooking tips. 
David earned his BA from Northeastern and has toiled in nearly every aspect of the food business, including as a line cook in Rhode Island where he once made a steak sandwich for Lamar Odom. 
Right now he's likely somewhere stress-testing a blender or tinkering with a toaster. Anything with sesame is his all-time favorite food this week. Expertise Kitchen tools | Appliances | Food science | Subscriptions | Meal kits      $30 at Amazon  A board made for meats Cutting board with juice groove  
      View details
       $130 at Amazon  French-made grilling duo with a secret third act Opinel Grilling Set  
      View details
       $28 at Amazon  You gotta cover it Grillman grill cover  
      View details
       $15 at Amazon  The baste in the business No-mess silicone brush  
      View details
              Grill season is a fun time for gadget and gear lovers. There's no shortage of instruments to enhance your backyard barbecue but not all are worth their salt. We'll leave the grill-cleaning robots and other hack grilling gear for someone else. Were looking for only the best grill tools you won't regret buying and we've tested dozens of grilling accessories, cleaning tools and cooking utensils to find them.Finding the perfect grill -- whether gas, charcoal, pellet or portable -- is the most important grilling purchase you'll make. But if your grilling tools have gotten crusty, rusty or outdated, this is the best barbecue equipment to haul in.After testing loads and eating even more, we made this finger-licking list of the best grilling tools for 2024.Best grilling tools for 2024     Not all cutting boards are created equal and this smartly designed block is perfect for grill masters. The sturdy bamboo board sports treads on one side to stabilize slick meats and a juice groove to catch all that liquid gold for basting or making sauce.        Photo Gallery 1/1       This is the biggest splurge pick on our list but the dashing Opinel set is well worth the price. The smartly designed 3-in-2 set includes a set of extremely sturdy tongs and a shark slicing and utility knife that flips down to make way for a spatula attachment when you need to flip.The Opinel set makes a most excellent gift for the grillin' guy or gal in your life.    Your gill cover doesn't need to be fancy but you should definitely have one. It'll extend the life of the grill itself and keep it looking like new for longer. This universal cover is just $27 and it's worth every penny if you don't already have one.     If you're not marinating your meat, you should be. Maybe it's because you don't have the right vessel to do it in. This collapsible prep tub is light and easy to clean. It doubles as a cutting board and triples as a bus bucket for dirty dishes after.     For basting sauce to go on your chicken and ribs, silicone is the way to go. The bristles will rinse clean in seconds so it'll be ready for action the next time you need it. Dreamfarm's clever version has a kink in the handle so you can rest it on a table without making a saucy mess. If you don't need extra light via your grill tools, then I say go for something sturdy that'll last you many seasons. You can definitely find cheaper grilling tools out there, but Weber's three-piece set is worth the extra few bucks and was my personal favorite.What I liked most about these -- especially the tongs and spatula -- is the length. If you work with a full-size grill, you know that stubby kitchen tools just don't quite get where you need them unless you put your forearm at serious burn risk. Each Weber tool in this small yet mighty set has a comfy handle and hook with which to hang 'em. Plus, the spatula has a sharp edge that you can use to slice and dice while you're working. If you don't leave these sturdy grilling compadres out in the rain, they'll definitely last you a good long time.    Paying $130 for a cutting board may seem like a lot, but this heavy-duty bamboo board from Meater is worth the cash. It's hefty and well-constructed and the juice channel around the outside makes it perfect for cutting grilled meats. It's big too -- 19.6 by 14.9 inches -- with enough real estate for a Thanksgiving turkey or a massive brisket. The first time I saw the Meater Plus, I knew I had to use it. I live in southern California, and the weather is pretty much always good enough to throw a rack of ribs or a spatchcock chicken on the grill. I do a lot of cooking out in the backyard, but a lot of it takes a long time to cook. You really want to cook slowly and evenly on a grill to keep the juices in.The Meater Plus lets me put the temperature probe into the meat and close the grill lid, and it maintains a connection to my phone. Not only is the connection tremendous, but if you tell the app what meat you are cooking, it can work out the resting time, too, giving you a perfect piece of meat every time.--James Bricknell, Senior EditorThermoWorks' Thermapen is about as accurate as meat thermometers get, and for certain types of barbecue or when cooking expensive steaks, that's rather important. Take this temp taker anywhere you flip meat: your deck grill, a campsite, even your Sunday tailgate party. Its portability makes it stupidly simple to accurately measure the internal temperature of your meat, wherever. There are plenty of knockoffs and cheaper versions of the Thermapen, but if you're serious about your internal meat temps, it's worth the extra coin. I also tested several WiFi-enabled smart thermometers, including the Yummly and Meater. I liked them both and they get points for accuracy as well as for providing loads of information, such as temperature tracking and some useful grilling tips. But you have to do all your temp reading from a smartphone, which proved either annoying or convenient depending on my mood.    You know that moment, when the grilling is finished and you look around at all the sauce bottles, spices and utensils and say, "What the heck just happened here?" A grill caddy will make it all go away with one breezy trip back to the kitchen. I didn't know how badly I needed one of these until I got one, and this lightweight caddy with a built-in paper towel rack is my pick.     Lights don't come standard on most grills and there's a good chance your grill is positioned somewhere without great direct lighting. If that's the case, a flexible lamp that attaches to the frame will make those late-evening and nighttime barbecue sessions far more enjoyable. The BBQ Dragon double light gives off plenty of glow but it's not so large that it'll get in your way. The two-headed approach means you can get bright light on both the grill surface and whatever is waiting beside it to go on next. With a grilling basket, you can easily and quickly grill your veggies and give them that smoky, slightly charred taste and perfect texture without the hassle of having to pick one piece up at a time. If you don't want to spring for this basket, you can always place a piece of chicken wire mesh on top of your grill so you can easily char foods that normally might fall through, like cherry tomatoes and other smaller vegetables or pieces of meat.Grill mats are another option, but they can get real nasty real fast. Also, they don't let the flames hit the food directly so you're less likely to get a nice char.For grilling fish without it falling to bits and down into your grill, you can also use grill mats or a basket. I like the basket because it lets the flames hit the filet and gives you that sultry summer char. Definitely go nonstick, as in this budget-friendly number for BBQ Guys. It opens and closes without much fuss and holds food securely over the flames. These are also great to bring along to a camping trip so you can cook right over an open fire. Note: You can use these for veggies but some will inevitably sneak through the cracks, so I prefer something like the above model.    If you don't want to bother with a fish grilling basket, at least saddle yourself with a proper spatula for fish. It'll help more than you might think and you can use it for anything, not just fish. This excellent and sturdy spatula is a bargain for $7 with its razor-sharp front edge that'll get right under those salmon and tuna filets without shredding them to bits.     Another way to grill flaky or sticky foods such as fish and veggies is on a mat. Don't expect grill marks or char when you use one of these fireproof nonstick mats, but do expect a spotless grill when you're done.     So simple, yet somehow I didn't think of it myself.      A wooden grill scraper may take just a little more muscle, but it also has some distinct advantages over its wire counterparts. It will go a little easier on your cast-iron or porcelain grates. It'll also shape itself to the grooves of your grill over time, and the scraper itself won't collect as much gunk as a wire brush. Plus, this one with a long handle to get some good leverage is just $7.     For a minimalist, this connectable and magnetic grill tool set boasts some very smart design. The two pieces act as fork and spatula but then connect to form a set of tongs. All three are on the small side but for a space-saving grill tool and utensil set, it doesn't get better than this.     Wood chips are an easy way to add substantial flavor to any grilled food, and work equally well on gas and charcoal grills. To use them you will need a box to hold the wood so they don't catch fire, but it's simple: Just place the box on top of the heat source -- on the gas burner or directly on the charcoal -- and they should start smoking and flavoring your food with whatever type of chips you've chosen. Weber's version is a good size for most grills and it's got a nice sturdy build.     If you're mostly a strip steak and burger griller you may not need a meat injector, but if you attempt the occasional rib roast, pork shoulder, brisket or thick steaks, this is the best way to get flavor all the way up in there. Use your favorite marinade or sauce and pump that good stuff in with this sturdy model that includes three different needles.     For charcoal grilling, a chimney becomes a must-have for your grill after you use it even once -- especially for us impatient folks. It keeps the charcoal all together tightly to help the briquettes get hot both quickly and evenly before you spread them around. It's a simple device, but Weber's is well-designed with a comfortable handle.     There are lots of fancy at-home pizza ovens on the market these days (I tried the Gozney Roccbox and loved it) but they ain't cheap. What's more affordable is a classic pizza stone, and it too will make crispy and delicious 'za. Just lay this puppy on a hot grill top for 20 to 30 minutes so it heats up and then slide a pie on top (with some cornmeal so it doesn't stick). You'll definitely need a pizza peel to do this successfully, but this $28 pizza bundle from Cuisinart includes one and a wheel to slice the pizza up with afterward.

# 海盗船SF1000电源评测：为高端小钢炮平台准备的最佳搭配 - 超能网

[Expreview](http://www.expreview.com/95049.html)

本文约 5990 字、49 张图表，需 10 分钟阅读
                        说到标准SFX规格电源，海盗船的SF系列产品毫无疑问是当中的佼佼者，甚至只要谈及高性能小钢炮平台的话题，那就一定离不开海盗船SF系列电源。不过如今PC电源已经进入ATX 3.0/3.1时代，而我们再去看SF系列电源时，却不难发现其仍然处于上一个世代，只有体积略大的SF-L系列才算是跟上了时代，难道说小钢炮平台真的要被时代抛弃了吗？答案显然是否定的。海盗船SF系列电源的新品可以说是“虽迟但到”，尽管他们在COMPUTEX 2024上才正式发布，但产品确实是诚意十足的，首发的SF750、SF850、SF1000三款产品涵盖了750W至1000W额定功率，均为标准SFX规格，采用全模组接口设计并配置有编织型模组线材，可以说非常明确地就是剑指高端平台，80Plus铂金认证与Cybentisc铂金认证则代表着其性能依然是顶尖水准，对于高端小钢炮的玩家来说，他们终于等来了心目中的“最佳搭配”。海盗船SF1000电源海盗船SF1000电源的尺寸为100x125x63.5mm，属于标准SFX规格电源，体积虽小但内部用料丝毫不含糊，1000W的额定功率就可以见一斑。值得一提的是，虽然当前最新的电源设计指南是ATX 3.1规格，但海盗船在电源包装上印刷的依然是“ATX 3.0”，这是因为ATX 3.0规格的要求其实比ATX 3.1规格要更高一些，海盗船是基于更高的要求去打造此款电源的。在外观设计上，SF1000电源延续了SF系列的简约型设计风格，采用全模组接口设计，模组接口也进行了小型化设计，在保证供电安全的同时可以接入更多线材，充分发挥电源的扩展能力，散热风扇则采用9215规格，支持智能启停功能。海盗船SF1000电源采用单路+12V输出设计，其中+12V最大额定电流为83.3A，相当于1000W输出功率，+5V与+3.3V最大额定电流均为20A，联合输出功率则为130W，支持100V至240V输入电压。值得一提是，现在-12V输出在电源设计指南中已经成为了可选项，考虑到SFX电源内部空间有限，海盗船在新的SF系列电源上已经取消了-12V输出，毕竟目前-12V在PC DIY领域中实际上已经没有实用价值，在“寸土尺金”的SFX规格电源中确实没有保留的必要。电源的模组接口采用了小型化设计，有6个8pin接口可用于扩展CPU与显卡供电接口，有3个6pin则用于扩展SATA供电以及D型4pin供电。值得一提的是，海盗船称SF1000电源配置的是12VHPWR供电接口，这是因为这款电源并未采用原生12VHPWR/12V-2x6模组接口，而是通过2个8pin接口扩展而出。海盗船认为这样的扩展方式在安全性上要高于原生12VHPWR/12V-2x6模组接口，而且目前无论是电源又或者是显卡都未能使用12VHPWR/12V-2x6供电接口的全部功能，双8pin扩展的12VHPWR接口已经可以满足当前的使用需求。电源所用的模组线材均为编织型线材，可以提供1个24pin主供电、2个4+4pin/8pin CPU供电、4个6+2pin PCI-E供电（均为单接口线材）、1个12VHPWR供电（双8pin转接线）、8个SATA供电与3个D型4pin供电接口，可以满足当前高端平台的使用需求。另外由于12VHPWR接口需要使用2个8pin模组接口，因此在使用对应的模组线后，就只剩下4个8pin模组接口能用于扩展CPU或PCI-E供电，换句话说电源标配的模组线在数量上是多于电源模组接口的。AC输入接口带有独立开关海盗船SF1000电源使用自家的NR092P风扇，这是一款直径为92mm、厚度为15mm的液态动压轴承风扇，电机规格为DC12V 0.22A，采用PWM进行调速，最高转速实测可达4100RPM。电源采用主动式PFC+半桥LLC谐振+同步整流+DC-DC结构，元件用料颇为扎实，内部空间基本上是全部用上，主PCB双面布局设计，元件排列紧密，+5V、+3.3V以及风扇控制模组则共用一块子PCB，模组接口PCB则为直插式设计，PFC控制器与谐振控制器分别为CM6502UHHX和CM6901X，安置在主PCB的正面，背面主要是+12V同步整流电路。可以看出，海盗船SF1000电源的内部结构与之前的SF系列产品是比较接近的，但是在细节位置进行了调整和优化。海盗船SF1000电源虽然是SFX规格产品，但是其在元件用料上并不逊色于同功率的ATX规格产品，具备完整的EMI电路的同时，主电容也用上了容量充足的740μF规格，整流桥、PFC开关管、PFC二极管以及主开关管则共用的一块高规格的散热片，8个+12V同步整流的MOSFET则布置在PCB背面，在住PCB上配置有散热片的同时，也可以通过导热垫将热量传导至外壳进行辅助散热。主PCB背面的+12V同步整流配置有8颗MosFET，整流管与续流管各有4颗电源的+5V与+3.3V采用DC-DC设计，配置有独立PCB海盗船SF1000电源额定功率为1000W，在115Vac与230Vac输入电压下的OPP过功率保护实测均为1449W，相当于是额定功率的144.9%，预留的功率空间非常充足，+12V、+5V与+3.3V的OCP过电流保护功能均正常工作，电压表现与转换效率表现在同功率产品中均为优秀水准，在SFX规格产品中算得上是佼佼者。动态负载方面，无论是10kHz高频又或者是低频50Hz下，海盗船SF1000电源的各路输出都能很好地控制峰值电压，各组输出均无电压过冲的情况。而在ATX 3.1规格验证上，目前业内比较重视的参数主要是2%轻载输出的转换效率，以及在120%、160%、180%、200%瞬时动态输出下的峰值功率表现。经测定海盗船SF1000电源在2%轻载也就是20W输出时，115Vac与230Vac输入电压下转换效率均可达到70%以上的水平，动态峰值功率的测试也全部通过，可以判定此款电源是具备ATX 3.1相关素质的。在230Vac输入环境下，海盗船SF1000电源的2%负载转换效率达到71.2%，50W负载与100W负载时的转换效率时则为81%和90%的水平，半载输出效率超过94%，满载转换效率有93%以上的水平，整体平均效率超过93%；在115Vac输入下，2%负载转换效率达到73%，最高转换效率超过93%，满载效率接近91%，平均转换效率则超过92%，这样的表现在同功率的产品中是非常优秀的。按照目前PC电源行业的常用标准，+5VSb待机在100mA/250mA/1A的负载下转换效率需要高于50%、60%、70%，空载待机功率小于1W。在这方面海盗船SF1000电源表现很不错，空载待机输入为0.1W，带载转换效率能达到较高水准，输出电压均在达标范围内。在静态均衡负载的状态下，海盗船SF1000电源的电压偏离率可以控制在2%以内，而电压调整率则能做到不超过0.5%的水准，从整体表现来看是非常可靠的。纹波和噪声是电源直流输出里夹杂的交流成分，如果用示波器观察，就会看到电压上下轻微波动，像水波纹一样，所以称之为纹波。按照Intel ATX 3.1规定，+12V、+5V、+3.3V的输出纹波与噪声的Vp-p（峰-峰值）分别不得超过120mV、50mV、50mV。我们使用数字示波器在20MHz模拟带宽下按照Intel规范给治具板测量点处并接去耦电容，对电源进行满载纹波的测量，以低频下的纹波峰峰值作为打分基准。海盗船SF1000电源在+12V、+5V、+3.3V满载低频纹波为20mV、11mV和9mV水平，符合ATX 3.1要求，在同级别产品也是很优秀的表现。交叉负载测试项目我们基于Intel ATX 3.1和SSI EPS12V 2.92电源设计指导的要求制定，但需要值得注意的是我们并非原封照搬设计规范，而只选择其中比较有实际意义的4个测试点作为评估项目，另有3个拉偏项目则作为参考数据，不纳入最终评分。这7个点的意义分别为：　　A：整机最小负载；　　B：辅路最大负载、12V最小负载，例如多个机械硬盘同时启动的情况；　　C：辅路最大负载、整机满载；　　D：12V最大负载、辅路最小负载，例如使用单个固态硬盘运行3D游戏的情况；　　E：12V负载拉偏，其余为0A输出；　　F：5V负载拉偏，其余为0A输出；　　G：3.3V负载拉偏，其余为0A输出；交叉负载的测试与前面的均匀负载测试的评判标准一致，电压偏离额定值越少越好，各路偏离率允许的值都为±5%。海盗船SF1000电源在+5V和+3.3V输出上使用了DC to DC设计，这个设计在交叉负载（拉偏测试）中是比较有利的，+12V、+5V、+3.3V输出在拉偏负载的情况下，电压偏离度都依然控制在3%之内，在同级产品中表现优秀。掉电保持时间（Hold-up Time）是指电源掉电之后电压输出值跌出范围允许的5%的时间，我们测量的是+12V、+5V、+3.3V和Power-OK（Power-Good）信号的保持时间。SSI EPS12V 2.92服务器电源设计指导中对输出电压保持时间的要求是电源在75%的负载下DC输出保持时间不小于18ms，Power-OK信号的保持时间不小于17ms；Intel ATX 3.1则是要求是电源在100%的负载下DC输出保持时间应该不小于12ms，Power-OK信号的保持时间不小于11ms。掉电保持时间如此受关注，是因为其很大程度上关系到硬件的寿命，Power-OK保持17ms意味着面临17ms以内的掉电情况时电脑能持续运行而不出现关机、重启的状况，而各路电压保持18ms或者更长的时间，是为了在掉电发生时各个硬件能够做出应急处理，比如机械硬盘的磁头归位
	、SSD的掉电保护。海盗船SF1000电源的保持时间是在75%负载（DC输出750W）和100%负载（DC输出1000W）的情况下测得。海盗船SF1000电源在75%负载下的PG/+12V/+5V/+3.3V保持时间分别为23.3ms、27.2ms、28.2ms和28.4ms，在100%负载下则分别为17.5ms、21.3ms、22.0ms和22.2ms，四项保持时间全部达标。在电源风扇转速与运行噪音项目中，我们使用了可零噪音运行的电阻式负载仪，并在我们的消音室中进行测量。测试时环境噪音控制在15dBA以下，室温则控制在33℃左右，噪音仪与电源风扇进风面的距离则为30cm。另外需要一提的是，当电源风扇处于停转的状态时，电源的运行噪音将被记录为0dBA，风扇起转后才记录实测噪音值。海盗船SF1000电源支持风扇智能启停功能，在电源输出功率超过350W后风扇进入启动状态，但启动后并不会因为输出功率的降低而重新进入停转状态，而是在低功率输出的状态下也维持较低的风扇转速。风扇调速采用了温度与功率双控制的方案，在室温为33℃的条件下，其在输出达到350W后风扇起转，此时风扇转速在500RPM左右，后续会随着输出功率的增加而逐步提升，在输出功率达到500W前都可以维持风扇转速1000RPM以下的状态，噪音方面则在输出650W前都能维持30dBA以下，变现非常安静。电源风扇在输出功率750W时会达到2000RPM的水平，运行噪音则在输出达到700W后会有比较明显的增加，满载时风扇转速达到2900RPM以上的水平，运行噪音也会增加提升至51dBA的水平。不过如果以40dBA（40dBA以内一般视为安静）作为分界线的话，那么海盗船SF1000电源需要在输出达到750W的水平后，运行噪音才会超过40dBA，这意味着在绝大部分的使用环境中，其实电源都能维持较低的运转噪音。按照我们目前的评分标准，海盗船SF1000电源的常规性能超能指数为93.05分，ATX 3性能指数为93.65分，两个分数都已经达到顶尖级电源的水准，适合高端平台装机使用。海盗船SF1000电源称得上是SFX规格产品中的理想之选，不仅符合ATX 3.0/3.1规格要求，在综合性能方面也有顶尖水准的表现，支持智能启停的风扇使得电源能在大部分使用时间里维持称得上是安静的运转噪音，编织型模组线材可以说是兼顾了耐用和手感，也赋予了电源足够的高端感。如果你要问高端的SFX电源应该是什么样子的，那我们可以说海盗船又一次交出了一份让人非常满意的答卷。海盗船SF1000电源的官方定价为1949元，肯定算不上是一个能让人轻松接受的价格，7年的质保服务也只是说是合理配置。不过考虑到海盗船的品牌定位以及电源自身的性能表现，倒也确实算得上是物有所值，毕竟能同时兼顾体积、噪音、功率以及综合性能就已经不是一件容易的事情，况且其不仅是SFX规格的佼佼者，即便与同功率的ATX规格产品相比也能有相当亮眼的表现，对于钟情高性能小钢炮平台的玩家来说，这显然是一个理想的选择。√ 优点：- 在标准SFX规格下实现1000W额定功率- 全模组接口设计，配置编织型模组线材- 综合性能优秀，符合ATX 3.0/3.1规格要求- 支持风扇智能启停功能- 提供7年质保X 缺点：- 无明显缺点

Keep these things in mind when shopping:Fill and materialThe magic of weighted blankets comes from the fill. Common fill materials include glass beads, plastic pellets and polyester microfill. Our hearts start to race, our muscles contract and our bodies are flooded with cortisol and adrenaline.  Studies have shown that deep-pressure stimulation can reduce cortisol levels in the body while increasing serotonin and dopamine levels. Weighted blankets are essentially big hugs that promote relaxation and reduce anxiety.  What are the benefits of a weighted blanket? Weighted blankets should only be 10% of a person's total weight. This means most adult weighted blankets aren't suitable for older children; they will be too heavy. Choose one specifically designed for children to ensure that it's correctly proportioned. Here are the key things to consider when letting older children use weighted blankets:Only purchase weighted blankets that are designed for children. The blanket should only be about 10% of your child's weight. Do not round up. Start with supervised use to ensure your child can move around and lift the blanket without assistance. Remember, weighted blankets are tested for adults. Speak to your child's doctor to see whether a weighted blanket is appropriate for them. There may be other things you can do to help your child sleep. Weighted blankets aren't a magic cure-all for anxiety and interrupted sleep, but they can help both things. They use deep-pressure stimulation to calm the nervous system and promote relaxation, similar to how swaddling blankets do for babies.More research is needed to fully investigate how weighted blankets work. Various studies show they do help trigger the parasympathetic nervous system, which relaxes the body. Care instructions vary for weighted blankets. Some of them are easier to wash than others. A lot of the best weighted blankets are machine-washable in some way. Some have a removable cover, while others are fully machine-washable on cold without a dryer cycle. Others are spot-clean only. Always read the label on your blanket for specific care instructions.Read more: How to Wash a Weighted Blanket in 3 Easy Steps Weighted blankets are available in different sizes and weights, but you should be strategic in your choice. The general rule: Choose a weight close to 10% of your body weight. Choose less if that's your preference, but refrain from choosing more. For reference, if you weigh 150 pounds, you're suited for a 15-pound weighted blanket or less. If you weigh 200 pounds, opt for a 20-pound blanket or less.   Weighted blankets can feel hot for some sleepers. Blanket manufacturers combat this by using certain knit materials or special cooling technology. If you're a particularly hot sleeper, stick to a blanket that focuses on cooling such as the Gravity Cooling weighted blanket.
